reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic place - The hotel is well laid out and maintained to a high standard. Rooms are very spacious with sea views and the gardens were also very nice. There's a great infinity pool, the food in the restaurant was tasty and the menu changed every day. Staff were also very helpful (although, it helps if you can speak some French - or Malagasy!). We were even offered a discount, because sadly the hotel was totally empty when we stayed, as a result of the recent political upheaval in Madagascar. The only negative is that there is no internet access available, which you would expect when they confirm bookings via a website. This was a bit of a pain because we needed to sort out some flights and the nearest internet access was over 30 mins drive along a very bad road. That aside, this is a lovely hotel and most definitely worth a visit if you're in that part of the world.
reviews.title: Paradise indeed
Great amenities, on the ocean
reviews.text: Somehow I lucked out and got the honeymoon suite, which was really stunning! Most of the rooms are bungalows and seemed very nice. The suite was about 3 feet from the ocean and had a large tub, hot water, electricity, a flush toiler, a private outdoor shower for post-beach cleaning. The suite also has an in-room safe and a mirror over the bed, as well as a mosquito net.
